title: Bug 27869 - StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData
description:
Bug 27869 - StyledText overuse of Font.getFontData
Btw, UTF8 is the default English encoding for Redhat 8.
FontMetrics API is also heavily used by the StyledText. I believe that the metric information should be cached in the StyledText and updated only when the font is changed.
OB:
Running eclipse, using the Java Editor:
- When a single key stroke is pressed, the API Font.getFontData() is called 13 times.
- This API is also overused when scrolling the StyledText and selecting text.
- Each Font has 7 FontData, therefore every time I type 'a' in the Java Editor, 91 (713) FontData will be loaded.
EB: I believe, and many people agree, that this API should not be used at all by the StyledText when it's being typed.
SR: Investigate the overuse of Font.getFontData() in the StyledText and optimize its usage. Consider caching the metric information in the StyledText and updating it only when the font is changed. Additionally, evaluate the need for using Font.getFontData() when the StyledText is being typed.
